[vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]How about an early-season skiing / snowboarding getaway? Europe can offer many gems to enjoy the slopes and have a relaxing winter holiday. We have collected some of the best ones for you.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_single_image media=”23263″ media_width_percent=”100″ uncode_shortcode_id=”294002″][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_column_text]

 

Gstaad, Switzerland


The picturesque village of Gstaad in Switzerland is one of the best and most glamorous ski resorts. Charming chalets, fabulous designer shops, Michelin-star restaurants are awaiting you. On the mountain, skiers can explore 200 km of slopes, reaching a snow-sure altitude of 3,000m.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_column_text]

 

Val-d’Isère, France

Val d’Isère with its 300 km of pistes has exciting, high-quality, snow-sure slopes also one of the biggest ski areas in France. With such an abundance of luxury ski chalets, vibrant nightlife and Michelin-star restaurants, Val d’Isere is one of the most popular European destinations to take on a luxury ski holiday.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_single_image media=”23283″ media_width_percent=”100″ uncode_shortcode_id=”213554″][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_single_image media=”23273″ media_width_percent=”100″ uncode_shortcode_id=”342583″][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_column_text]

 

Cortina, Italy

Often referred to as the ‘Queen of the Dolomites’ Cortina d’Ampezzo is one of the most elegant, fashionable and luxurious Alpine ski resorts. The skiing opportunities are endless, with 120 km of slopes to explore. The town is chic and lively: beautiful chalets, boutique shops, Michelin-star restaurants and wine bars. [/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_column_text]

 

St. Anton am Arlberg, Austria

St. Anton the largest interconnected ski resort in Austria and the fifth-largest in the world consists of more than 300 km of marked slopes. The village offers authentic mountain life too with its impressive dining scene with recognized restaurants. [/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_single_image media=”23278″ media_width_percent=”100″ uncode_shortcode_id=”198653″][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider][/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_single_image media=”22823″ media_width_percent=”100″ uncode_shortcode_id=”144577″][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_column_text]

 

St. Moritz, Switzerland

The oldest winter holiday resort that is also legendary for its weather: the sun shines on an average of 322 days a year. The choice of slopes is very extensive, the ski area has got 350 km of perfect slopes to offer. St. Moritz offers world-class hotels and restaurants, chic shopping and exclusive bars.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]Book your jet now and pack your bags![/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]
